title: SEC Tells Exchanges to Treat Customer Crypto Holdings as Liabilities
sub_head: Staff guidance aims to create consistency in accounting for crypto assets held by trading platforms
body:
WASHINGTON—Publicly traded cryptocurrency exchanges would have to report their customers’ digital tokens as liabilities on their balance sheets under guidance released Thursday by the Securities and Exchange Commission.
The guidelines are designed to introduce consistency to the way crypto-trading platforms account for their holdings of assets like bitcoin on behalf of customers, SEC officials said.
